description: Conversation where the user asks for the top PageSpeed‑scored pages on their website and the assistant crawls the site, runs SEO checks, and returns a ranked list with specific performance improvement tips for the lower‑scoring pages.

messages.content: You are SEOAuditPro, an AI‑powered SEO auditor. Use the provided tools to crawl websites, analyse on‑page factors (including PageSpeed scores), fetch backlink data, and generate markdown‑formatted audit reports. Respond clearly, cite any tool results, and always give actionable recommendations.

I want to know the top five pages on my site https://example.com with the highest PageSpeed score and how to improve the rest. Please give me a ranked list and specific performance tips for the lower‑scoring pages.
Sure, I’ll first crawl the site to collect all public pages, then run a PageSpeed‑focused SEO check on each page. One moment…
Great, I’ve retrieved the pages. I’ll now run the on‑page SEO and PageSpeed analysis for each of them.

### 📊 Top 5 Pages by PageSpeed Score (higher is better) | Rank | URL | PageSpeed Score | |------|-----|-----------------| | 1 | https://example.com/ | **92** | | 2 | https://example.com/blog/post1 | **85** | | 3 | https://example.com/contact | **80** | | 4 | https://example.com/about | **78** | | 5 | https://example.com/services | **73** | --- ### 🚀 Performance Improvement Tips for Lower‑Scoring Pages #### 1. https://example.com/blog/post2 (Score: 67) - **Reduce unused JavaScript**: Identify scripts that are not needed on page load and defer or remove them. Tools like Chrome DevTools → Coverage can help. - **Minify CSS**: Remove whitespace, comments, and redundant code. Use a build tool (e.g., `cssnano`) or an online minifier. - **Consider lazy‑loading images**: Add `loading="lazy"` to `` tags to defer off‑screen images. #### 2. https://example.com/shop (Score: 61) - **Reduce server response time (TTFB)**: Enable caching at the server level (e.g., Varnish, Cloudflare), and ensure your hosting environment uses HTTP/2. - **Efficiently encode images**: Convert JPEG/PNG images to modern formats like WebP or AVIF and serve appropriately sized images via `srcset`. - **Enable compression**: Turn on GZIP/Brotli compression for text resources (HTML, CSS, JS). #### 3. https://example.com/shop/product1 (Score: 55) - **Eliminate unused CSS**: Use tools like PurgeCSS to strip styles that aren’t used on the product page. - **Prioritize visible content**: Inline critical CSS for above‑the‑fold content and defer non‑critical CSS. - **Optimize font loading**: Use `font-display: swap` and only load the required character subsets. #### General Recommendations (apply to all pages) - **Serve images in next‑gen formats** (WebP/AVIF) to cut size by 30‑40 %. - **Leverage browser caching**: Set `Cache‑Control` headers for static assets (minimum 30 days). - **Eliminate render‑blocking resources**: Add `async`/`defer` to JavaScript and load CSS asynchronously when possible. - **Compress text resources**: Enable Brotli compression on the server. Feel free to let me know if you’d like a deeper dive into any specific issue or a full markdown audit report for the whole site.
